author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Chalmers says day one will focus on productivity, day two on sustainability, with RBA chief Bullock opening the final day to frame key discussions.
title: Chalmers Sets Productivity Roundtable Agenda, Optimistic About ‘Constructive Ideas’

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: Staff were required to complete a course on Indigenous perspectives on health.
title: Health Body Investigated Racial Slur Written on Hospital Whiteboard

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Four Quebec men, including two active-duty soldiers, accused in an anti-government plot had no “unescorted access” to military bases or equipment and “have not been performing military duties,” according to the Department of National Defence (DND). “At any time, should the integrity of a CAF [Canadian Armed Forces] member be called into question, various actions […]
title: Quebec Militia Plot Suspects Had Minimal Military Base, Equipment Access: DND

author: Phil Gurski
description: Commentary Remember Chicken Little (a.k.a. Henny Penny)? She was the one running around warning that the sky was falling and spreading panic all around. In the end, the heavens were not, in fact, plummeting, and we now use the phrase “Chicken Little” to describe those who spread myths about danger that are ill-founded. Last week, […]
title: The Threat From Far-Right Extremists Pales in Comparison to Jihadi Terrorism

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Heavy Rains in Pakistan, Bastille Day Military Parade, and Counting Swans on the Thames

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Alberta is calling on Ottawa to designate the India-based Bishnoi gang as a terrorist group, saying that such a designation would provide more tools in disrupting the group’s activities and protecting the public. In a July 14 statement, the province said that South Asian communities in Canada have been “disproportionately targeted” by the gang, which […]
title: Alberta Presses Feds to Declare Bishnoi Gang a Terrorist Entity

author: The Canadian Press
description: A man with ties to al-Qaida who allegedly threatened to bomb public transit will likely plead guilty, his lawyer said Monday at the Montreal courthouse. Mohamed Abdullah Warsame, 51, appeared in court by video conference from Montreal’s Rivière-des-Prairies detention centre, where he waived his right to a bail hearing. Warsame was arrested June 5 and […]
title: Man With Al-Qaida Ties Likely to Plead Guilty to Terror Offence in Montreal: Lawyer

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre is calling on Prime Minister Mark Carney to sell all the assets held in his blind trust to prevent potential conflicts of interest. Carney established a blind trust after being sworn in as prime minister in March and the details of how it operates were disclosed on July 11 by the […]
title: Poilievre Says Carney Should Sell His Assets After Ethics Screens Disclosed

author: Epoch Video
description: France celebrates Bastille Day with fireworks at the Eiffel Tower in Paris on July 14.
title: LIVE NOW: France Celebrates Bastille Day With Fireworks at Eiffel Tower

author: Riley Donovan
description: Commentary The post-nationalism declared by Justin Trudeau has been rejected, and Canadian nationalism is thoroughly back in vogue. The next logical step as a country would be to shelve post-nationalism’s ideological predecessor: Pierre Trudeau’s multiculturalism. Shortly after his election in 2015, Justin Trudeau described Canada as the world’s “first postnational state” with “no core identity, […]
title: Canada’s Future Lies in Its Shared Heritage, Not Post-Nationalism

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Nearly two-thirds of Canadians say they “desperately” need interest rates to fall as the escalating cost of living and ongoing economic uncertainty drive some households toward increased debt or bankruptcy, a new report suggests. Even if rates were to decline, 45 percent of people polled by Ipsos as part of the latest MNP Consumer Debt […]
title: Majority of Canadians Want Lower Interest Rates as Bankruptcy, Debt Fears Mount

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Teachers and school-sanctioned activities have been at the origin of many anti-Semitic incidents in Ontario’s K-12 school system, according to a new federal report. The report was commissioned by Canada’s Special Envoy on Preserving Holocaust Remembrance and Combatting Anti-Semitism and conducted by Robert Brym, a professor emeritus of sociology at the University of Toronto. The […]
title: Teachers Linked to 17 Percent of Anti-Semitic Incidents in Ontario Schools: Federal Report

author: Victoria Friedman
description: The review's lead, Peter Johnston, said that he did not find that HOYO Films 'intentionally misled' the BBC on the position of the narrator's father.
title: Review Finds BBC Breached Guidelines Over Gaza Documentary Narrated by Son of Hamas Official

author: The Canadian Press
description: A prominent Jewish organization is pushing for Canada to deny entry to two bands being investigated in the U.K. after their appearance at a popular British music festival last month. In late June the Centre for Israel and Jewish Affairs asked the ministers of public safety and immigration to bar Irish rap group Kneecap and […]
title: Immigration Minister Won’t Say If Canada Considering Barring British, Irish Rappers

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Heat advisories and air quality warnings have been issued across the country as elevated temperatures and wildfire smoke continue to affect several provinces. Environment Canada issued 90 heat advisories throughout Ontario, Quebec, Nova Scotia, and Newfoundland and Labrador on July 14, as well as hundreds of air quality statements or warnings across seven provinces and […]
title: Heat, Air Quality Advisories Issued Across Several Provinces

author: The Canadian Press
description: One of four men accused in an alleged anti-government plot to forcibly take possession of land in the Quebec City region has been granted bail. Matthew Forbes, 33, was ordered in Quebec court to comply with a lengthy list of conditions including wearing a GPS tracking bracelet. The other three accused—Simon Angers-Audet, 24, Raphaël Lagacé, […]
title: 1 of 4 Men Accused in Alleged Quebec Extremist Plot Granted Bail, 3 Remain Detained

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Brussels has signaled its readiness to impose countermeasures but stressed that a mutually acceptable U.S.–EU deal remains the preferred option.
title: EU Prepares Second List of US Goods Worth $84 Billion for Possible Tariffs

author: The Canadian Press
description: Hudson’s Bay is firing back at one of its biggest lenders. A new court filing from the defunct department store’s chief financial officer pushes back on the lender’s calls to subject the retailer to more oversight because it allegedly mishandled its liquidation and is hopelessly pursuing a deal to sell 25 of its leases. In […]
title: Hudson’s Bay Fights Lender That Wants Ruby Liu Deal Terminated: Court Docs

author: Frank Fang
description: Australia, Canada, the EU, Japan, and New Zealand have all issued statements marking the ninth anniversary of the landmark ruling.
title: Rubio Calls on China to Abide by Hague Court Ruling on South China Sea

author: The Canadian Press
description: Residents of a tiny rural community in eastern Ontario pressed police on Saturday for answers about a disturbing attack on a young girl that investigators believed was caused by an animal—until they arrested a teenager in the case. Nearly 100 people filled a small community centre in Quadeville, about 170 kilometres west of Ottawa, for […]
title: ‘Traumatic Time’: Police Face Questions in Quadeville, Ont., After Attack on Girl

author: Ryan Morgan
description: The president announced the tariff threat against Russia as he hosted NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte at the White House on July 14.
title: US Will Impose 100 Percent Secondary Tariffs on Russia If No Ukraine Deal in 50 Days: Trump

author: The Canadian Press
description: A Montreal college is facing $30 million in fines from the Quebec government for having too many students in its English-language programs. Claude Marchand, president of LaSalle College, says the fines, which relate to quotas imposed under Quebec’s 2022 language law, threaten the survival of the 65-year-old bilingual institution. “A $30 million fine is not […]
title: Quebec College Faces $30 Million in Fines for Too Many Students in English Programs

author: The Canadian Press
description: Montreal police say they arrested a man earlier this week who is alleged to be an associate of a Quebec billionaire accused of sex crimes. Officers say the 76-year-old is believed to have been part of the circle of Robert Miller, known for founding the Future Electronics company. The accused was arrested in Montreal and […]
title: Police Arrest Former Associate of Montreal Billionaire Robert Miller

author: Epoch Video
description: President Donald Trump participates in a meeting with NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte at the Oval Office at 10 a.m. ET on July 14.
title: LIVE NOW: Trump Meets With NATO Secretary General

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Don Cherry says his 2019 exit from Hockey Night in Canada was not a planned “exit strategy” due to ill health, despite recent comments made by former long-time co-anchor Ron MacLean. The now 91-year-old former co-host of Coach’s Corner said he was caught off guard by MacLean’s recent comments to the Kingston Whig Standard, which […]
title: Don Cherry ‘Disappointed’ By Ron MacLean’s Remarks on Health, Hockey Night in Canada Departure

author: Adam Morrow
description: Clashes erupted on July 13 between armed local residents and Bedouin tribesmen in Sweida’s Al-Muqawas district, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said.
title: Dozens Killed in Fresh Bout of Sectarian Violence in Syria’s Sweida, Govt Says

author: Epoch Video
description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum holds her daily news conference at 9:30 a.m. ET on July 14, two days after President Donald Trump imposed new 30 percent tariffs on Mexican goods.
title: LIVE NOW: Mexican President Holds Daily News Conference, Following 30 Percent US Tariff Announcement

author: Owen Evans
description: Senzo Mchunu has been suspended over allegations of collusion with cartels and efforts to derail murder probes.
title: South Africa’s Ramaphosa Suspends Police Minister Over Criminal-Link Allegations

author: Epoch Video
description: The Danish EU Presidency and the European Commission hold a press conference following the Foreign Affairs Council (Trade) meeting in Brussels at 8:15 a.m. ET on July 14.
title: LIVE NOW: Danish EU Presidency, European Commission Hold Press Conference

author: The Canadian Press
description: Halifax’s city council has directed the mayor to ask the Nova Scotia government for consultation on whether it is considering strengthening his authority. Council voted last week in favour of the motion to make the request for collaboration in a letter to Municipal Affairs Minister John Lohr, with only Mayor Andy Fillmore voting against it. […]
title: Halifax Council to Ask Nova Scotia for Consultation on Strong-Mayor Powers

author: Guy Birchall
description: Seoul's transport ministry announced the move following the release of a preliminary report into the Air India crash involving a Boeing 787-8 on June 12.
title: South Korea to Order Airlines Operating Boeing Jets to Examine Fuel Switches

author: Victoria Friedman
description: The spending plans come amid a push for European countries to increase their own defense spending.
title: Macron Says France Will Spend Additional $7.6 Billion on Military

description: This makes Trump the first elected political leader in modern history to receive two state visit invitations by a monarch.
title: King Charles Will Host Trump for Second State Visit to UK in September: Palace

description: Danish foreign minister Lars Lokke Rasmussen has warned against trade war with U.S. and said that the EU seeks to avoid escalation.
title: EU Trade Ministers Meet in Brussels After US Announces 30 Percent Tariff

author: Alex Wu
description: Submerging historical sites was another act of 'cultural revolution' by the CCP to destroy traditional culture, observer says.
title: Ancient Statues Emerge From Chinese Reservoirs as Reminders of CCP’s Cultural Ruin

description: An anonymous man has appeared in a video claiming more attacks could be imminent as police urge anyone with details to come forward.

description: The U.S. president criticized Russian President Vladimir Putin for continuing to launch drone attacks against Ukraine.
title: Trump Says US to Send Patriot Missiles to Ukraine, EU to Pay

author: Cindy Li
description: 'As both countries cooperate to advance decarbonisation, we also need to work together to address global excess steel capacity,' Albanese said on July 14.
title: Australian PM Pushes China to Help Decarbonise Steel Production, Deal with Overcapacity

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Maimon says adopting IHRA definition is vital to expose harmful stereotypes, double standards and rising new forms of anti-Semitic prejudice.
title: Ambassador Urges Canberra to Adopt IHRA Definition of Anti-Semitism

description: 'We don't discuss hypotheticals,' Defence Industry Minister Pat Conroy said.
title: Minister Says Australia Will Not Commit Troops to Conflict Ahead of Time

description: Leaked Treasury brief warned Labor’s housing target may fall short, but Chalmers says the release was an error and insists he’s “pretty relaxed” about it.
title: Treasurer Rules Out Further Super Tax Changes Amid Treasury Document Leak

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: The satellite will boost space domain awareness by tracking objects in orbit, as satellite numbers climb past 12,000 and continue to grow.
title: Optus to Launch Australian-Made Satellite in 2028

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: Australian golfer Grace Kim admits to having held self-doubt, but never gave up hope in the quest for her first major win.
title: Battling Through Doubt, Burnout and a Cold: Australia’s Kim Comes out on Top

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Her lawyer has called on NSW authorities to drop all charges, arguing she was the victim of excessive force during a peaceful protest.
title: Ex-Greens Candidate to Sue NSW Government Over Alleged Police Brutality

description: Australia's plan, devised by anti-Semitism envoy Jillian Segal, proposes her office 'monitor' media coverage.
title: NZ Jewish Leaders Want Hate Speech Laws Mirroring Australia’s Proposed Reforms

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: Decades of sometimes violent unrest are set to end as all parties announce they've reached an historic agreement.
title: New Caledonia Likely to Give up Push for Independence, Become a French State

author: The Associated Press
description: LONDON—A small plane crashed shortly after takeoff Sunday at London Southend Airport, which was closed until further notice, officials and witnesses said. No information on any casualties was immediately available. The plane operated by Zeusch Aviation in the Netherlands had flown from Athens, Greece, to Pula, Croatia, on Sunday before heading to Southend. It was […]
title: Small Plane Crashes After Takeoff at London Southend Airport

author: Alfred Bui, Daniel Y. Teng
description: 'You will never be able to produce a manufacturing industry of any consequence, as long as you have a [free] trade agreement with China,' said Dan Ryan.
title: Trump’s Tariff Playbook Could Save Aussie Industry From China: Commercial Lawyer

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: The Australian leader says he has kept his conversations on the topic private.
title: Albanese Talks ‘Cute Koalas’ in China as Taiwan Defence Question Goes Unanswered

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Hundreds of people gathered at Toronto’s Queen’s Park on July 13 to call for an end to the Chinese Communist Party’s persecution campaign against Falun Gong practitioners that began in China 26 years ago. The commemoration event consisted of a public demonstration of Falun Gong meditative exercises, followed by a rally with speeches, and concluded […]
title: ‘We Remember Those Lives That Were Lost’: Hundreds Gather in Toronto to Call for End to 26-Year Persecution of Falun Gong

author: Joseph Lord
description: NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte will be in Washington, D.C., on July 14, where he'll meet with President Donald Trump and other officials.
title: Trump Plans Meeting With NATO Secretary General on Ukraine
